meanings.definition: The quality or state of being amoral.
meanings.sent1: The amoralities of the character made it hard to trust them.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the amoralities of different societies in history.
meanings.sent3: The amoralities of the situation left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The amoralities of the business world can sometimes be shocking.
meanings.sent5: The vivid amoralities of the story lingered in the reader's mind.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that are considered to be outside of moral principles.
meanings.sent1: The detective was investigating the amoralities of the suspect.
meanings.sent2: Society often struggles with the concept of amoralities in art.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the amoralities of everyday life.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech highlighted the amoralities of the opposing party.
meanings.sent5: The striking amoralities of the movie left the audience in disbelief.
